title: What is a health care structure? - Quora

response.answer_text: In some countries there is a national system of standards and care funded through taxes. Some have a hybrid system with oversight, subsidies and some involvement of private insurance. Here in the US, we have a privatized hodgepodge of privatization, no set pricing, varying levels of coverage, co pays; and sick people who go bankrupt or go without. Veterans, those over 65 and the very poor are covered by the government at varying levels for various things; but politics get involved in this too

A health system, also every so often called health care structure is referred to institutions that deliver healthcare services to fulfil the health needs of the target population. The Indian health structure includes public and personal hospitals in addition to specialised Ayurvedic hospitals imparting this traditional Indian system of medicine. All main cities and mid-sized city centres have hospitals that offer an outstanding standard of care.
